Wushi of team509 reported this vulnerability via VeriSign iDefense Labs.Accessing a deleted or incorrectly initialized object can trigger code execution [CVE-2010-0492]. Simon Zuckerbraun reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a flaw in an ActiveX control in the processing of long URLs and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2010-0805]. The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 333C7BC4-460F-11D0-BC04-0080C7055A83. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.Accessing a deleted object can trigger code execution [CVE-2010-0807]. ADLab of VenusTech reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will gain access to a browser window in another domain or Internet Explorer zone on the target user's system [CVE-2010-0494]. Paul Stone of Context Information Security reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create HTML with specially encoded strings that, when loaded and submitted by the target user, will disclose information from the target user's system to the remote user [CVE-2010-0488]. Daiki Fukumori of Cyber Defense Institute Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0492.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2010-0494.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2010-0494.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Accessing a deleted or incorrectly initialized object can trigger code execution [CVE-2010-0267]. Secunia reported this vulnerability.A race condition in accessing an object can trigger code execution [CVE-2010-0489].Accessing a deleted or incorrectly initialized object can trigger code execution [CVE-2010-0490]. Alexander Kornbrust of Red Database Security reported this vulnerability. Ivan Fratric of iSIGHT Partners Global Vulnerability Partnership also reported this vulnerability.Accessing a deleted or incorrectly initialized object can trigger code execution [CVE-2010-0491]. Wushi of team509 reported this vulnerability via VeriSign iDefense Labs.Accessing a deleted or incorrectly initialized object can trigger code execution [CVE-2010-0492]. Simon Zuckerbraun reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a flaw in an ActiveX control in the processing of long URLs and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2010-0805]. The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 333C7BC4-460F-11D0-BC04-0080C7055A83. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.Accessing a deleted object can trigger code execution [CVE-2010-0807]. ADLab of VenusTech reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will gain access to a browser window in another domain or Internet Explorer zone on the target user's system [CVE-2010-0494]. Paul Stone of Context Information Security reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create HTML with specially encoded strings that, when loaded and submitted by the target user, will disclose information from the target user's system to the remote user [CVE-2010-0488]. Daiki Fukumori of Cyber Defense Institute Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0494.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2010-0530.title: Apple QuickTime Lets Local Users Access Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2010-0530.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple QuickTime. A local user can access potentially sensitive information.A local user can exploit a file permission flaw to access the contents of the "Apple Computer" directory in the target user's profile.Mac OS X systems are not affected.Geoff Strickler of On-Line Transaction Consultants reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0530.extra: A local user can access potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2010-0538.title: Java on Mac OS X Has Memory Access Error in Processing mediaLibImage Objects That Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2010-0538.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java on Mac OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Java applet that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an out-of-bounds memory access error in the processing of mediaLibImage objects and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Only the Mac OS X implementation of Java is affected.Marc Schoenefeld of University of Bamberg reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0538.extra: A remote user can create a Java applet that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2010-0539.title: Java on Mac OS X Window Drawing Signedness Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2010-0539.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java on Mac OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Java applet that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a signedness error in the handling of window drawing and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Only the Mac OS X implementation of Java is affected.Jonathan Bringhurst of Northrop Grumman and Jeffrey Czerniak reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0539.extra: A remote user can create a Java applet that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2010-0540.title: CUPS Web Interface Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2010-0540.body: A vulnerability was reported in CUPS. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.The CUPS web interface does not properly validate requests. A remote user can take actions on the interface acting as the target authenticated administrative user.Adrian 'pagvac' Pastor of GNUCITIZEN and Tim Starling reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0540.extra: A remote user can take actions on the target interface acting as the target user.

CVE-2010-0542.title: CUPS Null Pointer Dereference in 'texttops' Filter Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2010-0542.body: A vulnerability was reported in CUPS. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when printed by the target user, will trigger a null pointer dereference and execute arbitrary code on the target system with 'lp' user privileges.The Apple Product Security team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0542.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when printed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2010-0543.title: Mac OS X Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, and Upload/Access Files and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2010-0543.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can view or upload files on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted MPEG2 movie file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2010-0543]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. For version 10.6.x, this bug was fixed in version 10.6.2.When "Apply to enclosed items..." is selected in the Finder "Get Info" window, the ownership of the enclosed items is not changed [CVE-2010-0545]. As a result, the enclosed files and folders may have the wrong permissions. Michi Ruepp of pianobakery.com reported this vulnerability.A user can create a specially crafted disk image or remote share that, when unmounted by the target user, will exploit a symlink flaw in Folder Manager and cause an arbitrary folder to be deleted with the permissions of the target user [CVE-2010-0546].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary JavaScript to be executed by the Help Viewer in the local domain [CVE-2010-1373]. Systems prior to Mac OS X version 10.6 are not affected. Clint Ruoho of Laconic Security reported this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit a directory traversal flaw in iChat to upload files to arbitrary locations on the target user's system for users that are using AIM in iChat [CVE-2010-1374].A local user can invoke NetAuthSysAgent to execute certain operations and obtain system privileges [CVE-2010-1375]. Mac OS X version 10.6 is not affected.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a format string flaw in the processing of 'afp:', 'cifs:', and 'smb:' URLs to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2010-1376]. Systems prior to Mac OS X version 10.6 are not affected. Ilja van Sprundel of IOActive and Chris Ries ofCarnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.Open Directory uses a non secure connection if an SSL connection is not available when binding to a network account server via System Preferences. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can impersonate a network account server [CVE-2010-1377]. Systems prior to Mac OS X version 10.6 are not affected.A device on the local network can advertise a printing service with a Unicode character in the service name to cause printing in certain application to fail [CVE-2010-1379]. Filipp Lepalaan of mcare Oy reported this vulnerability.A remote or local user with access to a printer can cause an integer overflow in the cgtexttops CUPS filter and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2010-1380]. Mac OS X versions prior to version 10.6 are not affected. regenrecht reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A remote user can exploit a configuration flaw in the SMB File Server to obtain access to arbitrary files on the share [CVE-2010-1381].A remote user can create specially crafted Wiki content that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2010-1382]. The code will originate from the site running the Mac OS X software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted TIFF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2010-1411]. Kevin Finisterre of digitalmunition.com reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0543.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the target user, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the target site, or take actions on the target site acting as the target user.A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can upload files to arbitrary locations on the target user's system.

CVE-2010-0544.title: Apple Safari Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code or Access Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2010-0544.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML or other content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system or disclose potentially sensitive information.Andrzej Dyjak, Abhishek Arya of Google, Inc., Borja Marcos of Sarenet, Eric Seidel of Google, Inc., Paul Stone of Context Information Security, Masahiro Yamada, Matthieu Bonetti of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team, Ralf Philipp Weinmann (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), Eduardo Vela Nava (sirdarckcat) of Google Inc., Gianni "gf3" Chiappetta of Runlevel6, regenrecht (via iDefense), Ojan Vafai of Google Inc., Colin Percival of Tarsnap, Dave Bowker of davebowker.com, Aki Helin of OUSPG, Chris Evans of Google Inc., Sergey Glazunov, kuzzcc, Skylined of Google Chrome Security Team, Mark Dowd of Azimuth Security, Michal Zalewski of Google, Inc., Yaar Schnitman of Google Inc., James Robinson of Google Inc., Eduardo Vela Nava (sirdarckcat) of Google Inc., Marc Worrell of WhatWebWhat, wushi of team509 (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), and Apple reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2010-0544.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or access information on the target user's system.

CVE-2010-0545.title: Mac OS X Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, and Upload/Access Files and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2010-0545.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can view or upload files on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted MPEG2 movie file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2010-0543]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. For version 10.6.x, this bug was fixed in version 10.6.2.When "Apply to enclosed items..." is selected in the Finder "Get Info" window, the ownership of the enclosed items is not changed [CVE-2010-0545]. As a result, the enclosed files and folders may have the wrong permissions. Michi Ruepp of pianobakery.com reported this vulnerability.A user can create a specially crafted disk image or remote share that, when unmounted by the target user, will exploit a symlink flaw in Folder Manager and cause an arbitrary folder to be deleted with the permissions of the target user [CVE-2010-0546].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary JavaScript to be executed by the Help Viewer in the local domain [CVE-2010-1373]. Systems prior to Mac OS X version 10.6 are not affected. Clint Ruoho of Laconic Security reported this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit a directory traversal flaw in iChat to upload files to arbitrary locations on the target user's system for users that are using AIM in iChat [CVE-2010-1374].A local user can invoke NetAuthSysAgent to execute certain operations and obtain system privileges [CVE-2010-1375]. Mac OS X version 10.6 is not affected.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a format string flaw in the processing of 'afp:', 'cifs:', and 'smb:' URLs to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2010-1376]. Systems prior to Mac OS X version 10.6 are not affected. Ilja van Sprundel of IOActive and Chris Ries ofCarnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.Open Directory uses a non secure connection if an SSL connection is not available when binding to a network account server via System Preferences. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can impersonate a network account server [CVE-2010-1377]. Systems prior to Mac OS X version 10.6 are not affected.A device on the local network can advertise a printing service with a Unicode character in the service name to cause printing in certain application to fail [CVE-2010-1379]. Filipp Lepalaan of mcare Oy reported this vulnerability.A remote or local user with access to a printer can cause an integer overflow in the cgtexttops CUPS filter and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2010-1380]. Mac OS X versions prior to version 10.6 are not affected. regenrecht reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A remote user can exploit a configuration flaw in the SMB File Server to obtain access to arbitrary files on the share [CVE-2010-1381].A remote user can create specially crafted Wiki content that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2010-1382]. The code will originate from the site running the Mac OS X software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted TIFF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2010-1411]. Kevin Finisterre of digitalmunition.com reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0545.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the target user, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the target site, or take actions on the target site acting as the target user.A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can upload files to arbitrary locations on the target user's system.

CVE-2010-0549.title: Xerox WorkCentre 6400 PostScript Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Access the Network Controller Directory Structure
CVE-2010-0549.body: A vulnerability was reported in Xerox WorkCentre. A remote user can view files on the target Network Controller.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted PostScript document to access files on target Network Controller.WorkCentre 6400 is affected.
CVE-2010-0549.extra: A remote user can access files on the target Network Controller.

CVE-2010-0561.title: NetBSD Integer Signedness Error in azalia/hdaudio Drivers Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2010-0561.body: A vulnerability was reported in NetBSD. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can supply a specially crafted mixer index to the azalia_query_devinfo() function in azalia(4) or the hdaudio_afg_set_port() function in hdaudio(4) to trigger a kernel panic.Pierre Pronchery reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0561.extra: A local user can cause a kernel panic on the target system.

CVE-2010-0562.title: Fetchmail Heap Overflow When Displaying SSL Certificates in Verbose Mode May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2010-0562.body: A vulnerability was reported in Fetchmail. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote server can send a specially crafted certificate to trigger a heap overflow if the target fetchmail application is running in verbose mode. Certain non-printing characters can trigger the overflow and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vulnerability resides in 'sdump.c'.
CVE-2010-0562.extra: A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2010-0563.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Single Signon "Requires SSL" Option May Not Be Honored
CVE-2010-0563.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Application Server. The "Requires SSL" option may not be honored.As a result, a user monitoring the network may be able to obtain authentication credentials.
CVE-2010-0563.extra: The system may fail to use SSL when ostensibly required.

CVE-2010-0564.title: Trend Micro OfficeScan URL Filtering Buffer Overflow May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2010-0564.body: A vulnerability was reported in Trend Micro OfficeScan. A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted URL to trigger a buffer overflow in the Trend Micro URL Filtering Engine (TMUFE) and cause the service to stop operating.[Editor's note: The report indicated the vulnerability is a buffer overflow but did not indicate whether code execution was possible or not.]
CVE-2010-0564.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions and may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2010-0571.title: Cisco Digital Media Manager Lets Remote Users Access the System and Remote Authenticated Users Modify the Configuration and View Passwords
CVE-2010-0571.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Digital Media Manager. A remote user can take full control of the installed applications. A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration. A remote authenticated user can view user passwords.The software has default authentication credentials. A remote user with access to the credentials can take full control of the installed web applications, including settings, status, and deployment [CVE-2010-0570]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta03378 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration and obtain full access to the target device [CVE-2010-0571]. Versions 5.0.x and 5.1.x are affected. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtc46008 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can view Cisco Digital Media Player user credentials and LDAP credentials in error log messages and stack traces [CVE-2010-0572]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtc46050 to this vulnerability.The National Australia Bank's Security Assurance team reported two of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2010-0571.extra: A remote user can take full control of the installed applications.A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration.A remote authenticated user can view user passwords.

CVE-2010-0572.title: Cisco Digital Media Manager Lets Remote Users Access the System and Remote Authenticated Users Modify the Configuration and View Passwords
CVE-2010-0572.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Digital Media Manager. A remote user can take full control of the installed applications. A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration. A remote authenticated user can view user passwords.The software has default authentication credentials. A remote user with access to the credentials can take full control of the installed web applications, including settings, status, and deployment [CVE-2010-0570]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta03378 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration and obtain full access to the target device [CVE-2010-0571]. Versions 5.0.x and 5.1.x are affected. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtc46008 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can view Cisco Digital Media Player user credentials and LDAP credentials in error log messages and stack traces [CVE-2010-0572]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtc46050 to this vulnerability.The National Australia Bank's Security Assurance team reported two of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2010-0572.extra: A remote user can take full control of the installed applications.A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration.A remote authenticated user can view user passwords.

CVE-2010-0577.title: Cisco IOS TCP Option Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2010-0577.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a TCP segment as part of the TCP session establishment phase containing specially crafted TCP options to cause the target device to hang or reload.Systems with any of the following configuration items may be affected: * A specific TCP window size * TCP path MTU discovery (PMTUD) * Stateful Network Address Translation (SNAT) with TCP as the transport protocolCisco IOS XR is not affected.Cisco IOS XE is not affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsz75186 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0577.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to hang or reload.

CVE-2010-0578.title: Cisco IOS IKE Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2010-0578.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted Internet Key Exchange (IKE) packet to cause the target device to reload.Only Cisco 7200 Series and Cisco 7301 routers running Cisco IOS software with a VPN Acceleration Module 2+ (VAM2+) installed are affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb13491 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0578.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2010-0583.title: Cisco IOS H.323 Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2010-0583.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted H.323 messages to TCP port 1720 to create an interface queue wedge, causing the packets to remain in the queue. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta19962 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted H.323 messages to TCP port 1720 to trigger a memory leak and cause the target device to reload. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb93855 to this vulnerability.Only devices configured to process H.323 messages are affected by these vulnerabilities [not the default configuration].
CVE-2010-0583.extra: A remote user can cause the target interface to be blocked (queue wedge) or cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2010-0589.title: Cisco Secure Desktop ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2010-0589.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Desktop. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the ActiveX control and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 705EC6D4-B138-4079-A307-EF13E4889A82Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta25876 to this vulnerability.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2010-0589.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2010-0593.title: Cisco Video Surveillance Camera Discloses Passwords to Remote Authenticated Users
CVE-2010-0593.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Video Surveillance Cameras. A remote authenticated user can view user passwords.A remote authenticated user can load a specifically crafted URL to bypass access restrictions and view the passwords for all users on the target device.On the WVC200 and WVC210 camera, the remote authenticated user must have setup privileges to exploit this flaw.The following product versions are affected: * Cisco PVC2300 Business Internet Video Camera - Audio/PoE * Cisco WVC200 Wireless-G PTZ Internet Video Camera - Audio * Cisco WVC210 Wireless-G PTZ Internet Video Camera - 2-way Audio * Cisco WVC2300 Wireless-G Business Internet Video Camera - AudioThe Cisco PVC300 Pan Tilt Optical Zoom Camera is not affected.The Cisco RVS4000 4-port Gigabit Security Routers are also affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCte64726 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0593.extra: A remote authenticated user can view user passwords, including the administrator's password.

CVE-2010-0600.title: Cisco Network Building Mediator Lets Remote Users Login and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2010-0600.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Network Building Mediator. A remote user can login to the target system. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including passwords.The system uses default credentials are assigned for several user accounts, including the administrative user account [CVE-2010-0595]. A user can login with administrative privileges. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb83495 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can read and modify the device configuration [CVE-2010-0596]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb83607 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can read and modify the device configuration and cause the device to reload [CVE-2010-0597]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb83618 to this vulnerability.A remote user monitoring the network can monitor HTTP sessions to access administrator credentials [CVE-2010-0598]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb83631 to this vulnerability.A remote user monitoring the network can monitor XML RPC sessions to access administrator credentials [CVE-2010-0599]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb83505 to this vulnerability.A remote user can read one of the system configuration files, which includes passwords [CVE-2010-0600]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb83512 to this vulnerability.The legacy Richards-Zeta Mediator products are also affected by these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2010-0600.extra: A remote user can login with administrative privileges.A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including passwords.

CVE-2010-0625.title: NetWare FTP Server Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2010-0625.body: A vulnerability was reported in NetWare's FTP Server. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user, including an anonymous user, can send a specially crafted 'mkdir', 'rmdir', 'rnfr', or 'dele' request to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on August 26, 2008 and January 25, 2010.Francis Provencher (Protek Research Lab's) reported this vulnerability. Nick DeBaggis reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2010-0625.extra: A remote authenticated user, including an anonymous user, can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2010-0629.title: Kerberos kadmind Memory Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2010-0629.body: A vulnerability was reported in Kerberos kadmind. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted kadmin API version number or other data to cause the target service to reference previously freed memory and crash.Using a newer version of the kadmin protocol than the server supports can trigger this flaw.Sol Jerome reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2010-0629.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2010-0643.title: Google Chrome Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Obtain Information
CVE-2010-0643.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Google Chrome. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain redirection references.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerabilities include integer overflows in the v8 engine and deserializing sandbox message, an error in processing the '<ruby>' tag, a leak of the redirection target that can be exploited via a specially crafted '<iframe>' href link, an error affecting DNS and the fall-back behavior of proxy servers, and an error in populating the HTTP authentication dialog with certain domain data.Eric Roman of the Chromium development community, Christopher Eatinger, Mark Dowd (contracted to Google Chrome Security Team), SkyLined of the Google Chrome Security Team, and Timothy D. Morgan of VSR reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2010-0643.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain redirection references.

CVE-2010-0644.title: Google Chrome Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Obtain Information
CVE-2010-0644.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Google Chrome. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain redirection references.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerabilities include integer overflows in the v8 engine and deserializing sandbox message, an error in processing the '<ruby>' tag, a leak of the redirection target that can be exploited via a specially crafted '<iframe>' href link, an error affecting DNS and the fall-back behavior of proxy servers, and an error in populating the HTTP authentication dialog with certain domain data.Eric Roman of the Chromium development community, Christopher Eatinger, Mark Dowd (contracted to Google Chrome Security Team), SkyLined of the Google Chrome Security Team, and Timothy D. Morgan of VSR reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2010-0644.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain redirection references.

CVE-2010-0650.title: Google Chrome Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, and Obtain Information.
CVE-2010-0650.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Google Chrome. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass the pop-up blocker. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass restrictions on pop-up windows. SkyLined from Google Chrome Security Team reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML CSS code that, when loaded by the target user, will access information from a different domain. Chris Evans of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system when the target user performs certain actions. Jacob Balle and Carsten Eiram from Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted XMLHttpRequest may be able to access local directories in certain cases. The vendor reported this vulnerability.A remote user may be able to obtain information from the target user's system when the target user creates shortcuts. Michal Zalewski of the Google Security Team and Inferno of SecureThoughts.com independently reported this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the canvas rendering code to execute arbitrary code within the context of the Chromium sandbox. Michal Zalewski on the Google Security Team and SkyLined of the Google Chrome Security Team reported this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the image decoder to execute arbitrary code within the context of the Chromium sandbox. Robert Swiecki of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.The browser may fail to strip the HTTP Referer field in certain cases.A remote user can access data from a different domain. Tokuji Akamine, Senior Consultant at Symantec Consulting Services, reported this vulnerability.A remote user may be able to exploit Bitmap deserialization bugs to cause the browser to enter an invalid state. Mark Dowd reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create an excessively nested URL that will cause the target user's browser to crash.
CVE-2010-0650.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass the pop-up blocker.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
